ygData.subject: Re: Re: Ideas for Womens Guild
ygData.msgSnippet: I m sooooooooooo chaste in real life! Do I have to be chaste in Norrath too? ... I can show up tonight if I am needed. (Lady Raider) ... From: Melissa Wilson
ygData.messageBody:
I"m sooooooooooo chaste in real life! Do I have to be chaste in Norrath too?
>smile<

I can show up tonight if I am needed.

(Lady Raider)
-----Original Message-----
From: Melissa Wilson <moontiger@...>
To: eq_women@onelist.com <eq_women@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, July 21, 1999 11:14 AM
Subject: RE: Re: [EQ_women] Ideas for Womens Guild


From: "Melissa Wilson" <moontiger@...>


>I'm not too sure about that one myself, the chaste part, I took it from
>actual conversations with the sisters on the isle. My best guess is that
>the sisters strive to be chaste because they don't want their love to be
>bound and focussed on any one person. I'd like to see the whole chaste
>thing as a role playing element we can use if we want to, and not use if
>we don't want to.

But do we have to be like the NPC Sisters? Seems to me the player guild can
be
different (like allowing men in, for one thing). Honestly, the ancient
custom
of sacred prostitution (hence sharing the love of the Goddess with Her
worshippers) seems more likely to me, but not something we would necessarily
want to implement! But I am not too big on the chastity idea either - who
says
Sisters are monogamous in their love?
If nothing else, my character is unlikely to be chaste, but I would hate to
have

to view this choice as violating her vows to the Goddess, if you see what I
mean.

>As for the men-protecting-the-women thing, it can be taken that way, but
>it doesn't have to. I was basicly just trying to identify a nice way in
>which men could be incoroporated into the guild. Your character could
>choose to not have a warder, and that would be a valid choice. If I were
>to have a warder, I would see him as a default following of Erollisi
>looking to serve his god, and not as someone I needed for protection.
>Others might choose to define their relationship with their Warder in a
>different way (love, protection, siblings, or even the sister protecting
>the Warder?)

I would seriously have to ponder the issue for my own character. Guess we
will
see how it goes.
Anyway, good luck!




Melissa
ICQ#23767351
"If Moses had been Pagan, there would have been drummers and dancers around
the burning bush."
